titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States allowing castration after conviction for the rape of a child under 16 years of age.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties.

bill.summary:
5/8/2008--Introduced.
Constitutional Amendment - Declares that surgical or chemical castration is permitted under the Constitution upon conviction of the rape of a child under 16 years old and does not constitute cruel and unusual punishment.
